bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 10, 1917

div1.p: Gorgas informs Kean that he has already appointed officers for the Ambulance Corps in France. Kean may fill other places when he arrives.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 10, 1917
div1.opener:
wcg hhw
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON,
August 10,1917.
Colonel J.R. Kean, Medical Corps, U.S. Army,
C/o Chief Surgeon,
American Expeditionary Force,
Paris, France.
My dear Kean:
div1.p:
Yours of August the 2d is acknowledged.
By this time I have no doubt you are on your way to
France, dodging submarines. But in this office we
get very little information on this subject. We do
not even know whether or no you have started. I
have taken steps to fill the colonelcy and the two
lieutenancys of the Ambulance Corps and when you get
to France you can take the necessary steps to fill the
other places.
Mrs. Gorgas joins me in kindest regards.
